thread.title: Texas A&M 28, Arkansas 21 (OT): Complete coverage

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Texas A&M 28, Arkansas 21 (OT): Complete coverage
text:
No. 14 Texas A&M 28, Arkansas 21 (OT)
Full coverage
Box score
ARLINGTON -- Kyle Allen threw for 358 yards, with a 20-yard touchdown to Christian Kirk in overtime as No. 14 Texas A&M completed another late comeback against Arkansas, winning the SEC opener 28-21 on Saturday night.
The Aggies (4-0) had a chance to win the game on the final play of regulation, but Taylor Bertolet's 38-yard field goal attempt was just wide right.
Allen, who was 21 of 28 passing with both of his touchdowns to Kirk, hit the true freshman receiver in the end zone on the second play of overtime.
Arkansas (1-3, 0-1) then got its chance, but DeVante Harris tipped away Brandon Allen's pass to Drew Morgan on fourth-and-4 from the 19.
Kirk finished with eight catches for 173 yards. Josh Reynolds had three catches for 106 yards, including a 63-yard play to set up Texas A&M's touchdown with 2:50 left before catching the tying 2-point conversion.

Hairopoulos: Instant replay ... like in 2014, Aggies rally, top Arkansas in OT 28-21
Deja blue: Arkansas' Bielema sees losing trend continue with another OT loss to A&M
Texas A&M quick hits: Aggies post first sack vs. Arkansas this season; Razorbacks hog the ball
Five thoughts: Red zone struggles for A&M, but freshman WR Kirk continues to impress
Photos: Hugs for Reveille; lots of tailgate action before Aggies rally to top Arkansas 28-21 in OT
